page.title: 19THE GARDENS OF GLYNDEBOURNE
page.content: Some of us were in a production at Glyndebourne and when we were not working we would walk into the car park and look at some of the cars. Then we might go to the lake and look at the fish such as pike and bream. We would go into the gardens. They are divided into rooms. The walls are hedges. We would look at the urn and all the flowers. On the far side there is a wood where we could play hide and seek. There's a wendy house in the wood and a ha-ha which keeps the sheep and cows from getting up onto the lawn and trampling the flowers. One day we found an old champagne cork. Some days we used to play cricket and have our bacon sandwiches and icecream like the audience who picnic on the lawns during the intervals.
